title: Horse Honored for Korean War Service
text: Horse Haldalgo, representing life-saving US Marine horse Sergeant Reckless who served with the US Marine Corps during the Korean War, is awarded with the PDSA Dickin Medal beside Sergeant Mark Gostling, on top, and Lieutenant Colonel Michael Skaggs, hidden, in London, Wednesday, July 27, 2016. Reckless, who survived one of the bloodiest battles in modern military history, has today been awarded the PDSA Dickin Medal – known as the animal equivalent of the Victoria Cross – for her bravery and devotion to duty during the Korean war 1950 until 1953. (AP Photo/Frank Augstein)
description: A U.S. Marine Corpse horse named Sgt. Reckless was honored with the Dickin Medal during a Korean War Memorial Ceremony in London.
